meanings.definition: A person who denies or contradicts something.
meanings.sent1: The negater in the debate kept disagreeing with everyone's points.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the office negater because she always finds fault in everything.
meanings.sent3: The negater at the party refused to believe that the cake was homemade.
meanings.sent4: His sister was a human negater, always challenging his ideas and beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The courtroom was filled with tension as the negater cross-examined the witness.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that cancels out or neutralizes something.
meanings.sent1: The noise-cancelling headphones acted as a negater of the loud construction sounds.
meanings.sent2: The air purifier functions as a negater of harmful pollutants in the air.
meanings.sent3: The negater machine made the unpleasant smell disappear in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The water filter is a powerful negater of impurities, providing clean drinking water.
meanings.sent5: The negater shield protected the spaceship from the harmful radiation of space.

meanings.sent1: She tried to negater the rumors by providing evidence of her innocence.
meanings.sent2: The antidote was able to negater the effects of the poisonous snake bite.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to negater the bad review only made the situation worse.
meanings.sent4: The magician used his wand to negater the spell and free the trapped bird.
meanings.sent5: The scientist worked tirelessly to negater the harmful effects of the chemical spill.
